intro: Cleistanthus dallachyanus, commonly known as the Dallachyana cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, often glossy leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
